Package application_frames

Class MainFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • custom_components.CustomJFrame
                • application_frames.MainFrame

  • public class MainFrame
extends CustomJFrame
    Main frame of the application.
    At the initial start of the application, the settings frame is first displayed to set the database connection and general drawing settings.

    It uses the Group layout primarily to arrange the components contained.
    The frame is divided into two, using the JSplit pane.

    The initial bounds of the mainframe is 15inch (resolution 1366 x 768), which can be resized.
    The left side contains the current drawing description and the list of layers arranged in table of contents. The width can also be resized during runtime

    The other (right) part is composed of the drawing panel (at the middle), the tool bar (top) and the message/ log area at the bottom.
    This other part is managed by using the Group layout and stretches to the right when window is resized.

    Most of the activity (actions) happens at the DrawingJPanel class, the MainFrame handles common tasks such as adding new layer to the table of contents, importing and exporting files and choosing the a shape to be drawn and general interface to other application frames in the program e.g. DatabaseCatalog, Settings Frame etc.

    Since:
    Dec 7, 2017
    Version:
    a. Dec 20, 2017 : Integrate database connection parameters from the settings frame.
    b. Dec 26, 2017 : Removed the overloaded constructor with a database connection and changed it to a private method within the class.
    c. Dec 27, 2017 : Integrate drawing settings from the settings frame.
    d. Dec 28, 2017 : Created separate (popup) frame for saving and opening drawing sessions.
    e. Dec 28, 2017 : Created separate (popup) frame for importing and exporting CSV files.
    f. Dec 28, 2017 : Validate adding layer with same name on the table of contents
    g. Dec 29, 2017 : Implement look and feel
    i. Dec 31, 2017 : Integrate CSV loading and export to/from the drawing space;
    Author:
    Olumide Igbiloba
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Launch the application.
        Parameters:
        args - argument

      • start

        public void start​(DatabaseConnection dbConnection)
        Starts the mainframe with a database connection
        Parameters:
        dbConnection - database connection for storing/ retrieving drawn shapes

      • saveLayerToDB

        public static boolean saveLayerToDB​(Layer layer)
        Saves a layer to the database
        Checks for existing layers from the database
        Prompts to overwrite the layer if the same name was found
        After saving, the layer notSavedState will be turned to false.
        Parameters:
        layer - layer to be saved to the database
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful

      • createNewLayer

                                  java.lang.String layerName)

      • createLayerFromResultSet

        public static Layer createLayerFromResultSet​(java.sql.ResultSet resultSet,
                                             java.lang.String layerName)
        Creates a new layer from a database result set
        Parameters:
        resultSet - result set from database query
        layerName - the new layer name to store the features contained in the result set
        Returns:
        null

      • createFeatureFromResultSet

        public static void createFeatureFromResultSet​(Layer newLayer,
                                              java.lang.String layerType,
                                              boolean isEllipse,
                                              java.lang.Double[] aX,
                                              java.lang.Double[] aY,
                                              double rx,
                                              double ry)
        Creates a feature from a result set
        Parameters:
        newLayer - the layer to add the feature into
        layerType - the layer geometry type e.g Polygon
        isEllipse - if the feature is an ellipse
        aX - array of X coordinates
        aY - array of Y coordinates
        rx - radius at X
        ry - radius at Y

        Gets the current feature type selected on the drawButtonGroup
        Returns:
        the selected feature type

        Parameters:

      • updateLayerComboBoxModel

        public static void updateLayerComboBoxModel​(java.lang.String[] listOfLayersInString)
        Updates the list of layer names on the combo box list.
        The index of an item on the list is equivalent to the index on the table of contents
        Parameters:
        listOfLayersInString - new layer names to be updated

      • updateDrawButtonGroup

        public static void updateDrawButtonGroup​()
        Updates the list of drawable geometries based on the current layer selected
        This is done when: a. Before edit session is started b. When the layer in the combo box is changed

      • disableAllDrawButtons

        public static void disableAllDrawButtons​()
        Disables all draw buttons.

      • releaseAllOtherToolsButton

        public static void releaseAllOtherToolsButton​(java.lang.String geometry)
        Releases all draw buttons that cannot be drawn on a specific geometry type.
        The buttons are identified from their corresponding action commands.
        Parameters:
        geometry - the geometry type to ignore

      • renameLayerInDatabase

        public static void renameLayerInDatabase​(java.lang.String oldName,
                                         Layer layer)
        Renames a layer in the database by dropping the old layer's table and writing a new one.
        The layer combo list is also updated.
        Parameters:
        oldName - old layer name
        layer - layer to be written
